channel.title: EDITuse item on object to start a case?+ a question
channel.description:
ok how do i make it so when i use raw manta on range it starts the case i made? ty =[]
Question: how do I make items require a level I.E. I want red fremmy cape to require 99 strength, how? gold fremmy cape to require 99 magic, how? green = range pink = hp silver = prayer black = attack teal\purple = defense (also, which one do you think represents defense better? thanks)
Thanks For Your Time, Le Hawtz

item.title: EDITuse item on object to start a case?+ a question
item.dc:creator: @analrape analrape
item.description:
@analrape wrote:

u dont have to use a case when u use item on object,use the item on object method located in

			case 192:

there may be more case 192’s make sure its the use on object one

something like this

else if(useItemID == 2349 && atObjectID == 2783)//1st = item ID 2nd object ID { //Put your stuff here }

to make it yourself easy,renove the case u made for it and put the stuff in a void then put

voidnamehere(); inot the thing above

Read full topic

item.title: EDITuse item on object to start a case?+ a question
item.dc:creator: @Mmmm_Java Mmmm Java
item.description:
@Mmmm_Java wrote:

[quote=“Mmmm Java, post:4, topic:78760”]yes[br][size=1]Posted on: April 11, 2007, 10:39:18 PM[/size][hr]

if (playerHasItem(389) && playerLevel[7] >= 40 && playerLevel[7] < 60) {
} else if (!playerHasItem(389)) {

the code I gave is like this, if you have the raw manta ray and level is right it will do what you say else if you do not have the raw manta ray ‘!playerHasItem(389)’ it gives the message that you dont have it

Read full topic
